p: According to the Interagency Coordinating Group (IACG) on Antimicrobial Resistance (AMR), drug-resistant diseases could cause 10 million deaths each year by 2050. Nowadays, at least 700,000 people die each year due to drug-resistant bacterial infections, including multidrug-resistant tuberculosis, of the respiratory and urinary tract, and sexually transmitted infections [ 81]. The significant number of studies on the use of essential oils and their components against multidrug-resistant bacteria show the exceptional potential of these natural products to curb the development of antibacterial resistance.
